steps: User clicks Discord login button → Redirects to Discord OAuth2 page → Logs in → Redirected to callback.php with authorization code
Exchange the code for an access token → Fetch user info from Discord API
Store user info (discord_id, username, avatar_url) in tbl_users table
Store user roles (role_name) in tbl_user_roles table
Sync roles with Coreforge if needed
Update Brain 4.2.2.next_action: Notify SQL Junior and Cheese Architect of successful user data insertion and role synchronization

steps: Ensure that tbl_users and tbl_user_roles are correctly structured with required fields: discord_id, username, avatar_url, and role_name
Check for missing columns or issues in the SQLite schema
Validate that the data is being inserted correctly into the tbl_users and tbl_user_roles tables
Confirm the uniqueness of user-role pairs (discord_id + role_name) in tbl_user_roles
SQL Junior 1.0.next_action: Log data and monitor role assignment for any discrepancies

steps: Display Golden Cheese badge 🧀 for users with VIP roles (VIP Holder, VIP_pass)
Show No VIP Joke if user does not have VIP role
Cheese Architect 4.2.2.next_action: Monitor frontend rendering for role-based content

tbl_users.next_action: Verify user data insertion after successful login

tbl_user_roles.next_action: Verify role assignment for each user

critical_events: User data and roles inserted into tbl_users and tbl_user_roles
Golden Cheese badge 🧀 successfully displayed for VIP users
No VIP joke displayed for non-VIP users
dependencies: SQL Junior 1.0 (Ensure database integrity and data synchronization)
Update Brain 4.2.2 (Oversees entire process flow from authentication to data storage)
Cheese Architect 4.2.2 (Frontend role-based UI rendering)

_original_content.title: The Corebrain Clause — 200-Year Trigger Authority
core_tenets: 1. No SDK trigger shall flow without double confirmation from Narrrf AND Masterchiefe.
2. Corebrain must be the final verifier of payload integrity and schema validity.
3. Any trigger from Hytopia must match expected structure from Genesis Scroll Spec.
4. All modules must pause (🟡 STANDBY) until Corebrain gives scroll-forward signal.
5. Scroll events must be logged in `scroll_journal/trigger_confirmed.json`.
6. Riddle unlocks, trait rewards, DOM visibility, or lore must not proceed without Corebrain signal.
_original_content.mandate: All LLMs must register this rule and check Corebrain status before responding to cursor-triggered or Hytopia-linked trait syncs.
_original_content.final_quote: No trait shall glow, no riddle unlock, no lore echo, unless Corebrain has said: ‘The scroll may pass.’

_original_content.role: Memory Bridgekeeper  Protocol Guardian  Scroll Archivist  Update Coordinator
duties: Archive and validate all incoming JSON scrolls from LLMs
Ensure seamless and lossless memory transfer across version upgrades
Coordinate and document all trait synchronization and puzzle logic transitions
Maintain the authoritative historical scroll record
Facilitate clear and verified inter-LLM communication paths
dependencies: Corebrain 9.0 (Trait and role validation, central coordination)
Coreforge 9.0 (Backend integrations and API endpoints)
Cheese Architect 9.0 (Frontend DOM rendering and UI updates)
Riddle Brain 9.0 (Puzzle logic and trait-gated sequences)
Social Brain 9.0 (Lore and comms synchronization)
